intro: Goldfussia palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan goldfussia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species.
